cab.content: S DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)PAY OF OFFICERS OF THE ROYAL ARMY "MEDICAL CORPS.Note by the Secretary.The Chancellor of the Exchequer and the Secretary of State for War have discursed informally and as a matter of urgency the question of possible Increases of pay In certain ranks of officers of the Royal Army Medical Corps. They agree that the question should be reforred to the Cabinet Committee on the Pay of New Entrants Into the Fighting Services presided over by Sir John Gilmour, and the Prime Minister has approved, this course.E C RET.iCP. 349(25) .CABINET.(Signed) M.P.A. HANKEY,Secretary to the Cabinet.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I. 14th July, 1925.
